newsitem.title: USA: Fourth Shift Q1 hurt by software revenue.
newsitem.headline: Fourth Shift Q1 hurt by software revenue.

text.p: Fourth Shift Corp said Thursday its loss in the first quarter was primarily due to shortfall in software license revenue.
This shortfall was due to competitive pressures at the lower end of the market combined with delayed purchasing decision from a few, larger multi-site prospects, Fourth Shift said in a news release.
The company's new decentralized business objects product, continues on track for a June 1997 general release, the software company said.
Fourth Shift reported a first quarter loss Thursday of $1.3 million, or $0.13 a share, compared to a profit of $310 million, or $0.03 a share a year ago.
